title: Over the Ocean; or, Sights and Scenes in Foreign Lands
author: Guild, Curtis
snippet: Think of standing in John Knox's pulpit, and thumping, with yourcurious, wonder-seeking hand, the same desk that had held his Bible, orbeen smitten by his indignant palm, as he denounced the church of Rome,nearly three hundred years ago; of looking upon the very stool thatJenny Geddes launched at the head of the Dean of St. Giles, when heundertook to introduce the liturgy into Scotland, in 1565; and seeingone of the very banners of the Covenanters that had been borne amid thesmoke and fire of their battles; nay, there, in a glass case, we saw theold Scotch Covenant itself, with the signatures of Montrose, Lothian,and their associates.
